intro: Orthrosanthus chimboracensis var. acorifolius, commonly known as the Chimborazo bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Ecuador. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, adapting to the harsh climate of its habitat. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
